title: RFK Jr., Rejecting Vaccine Data, Fuels Distrust of Public Health Agencies
summary: By promoting suspicions about the institutions he oversees, critics say Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is jeopardizing public health. He says he is pursuing transparency.

title: Trump Downplays Post Threatening Chicago, Saying He Wants to ‘Clean Up’ City
summary: The president had said on social media that Chicago was “about to find out why it’s called the Department of WAR,” drawing a fierce rebuke from Democrats.

title: Russia Strikes Ukraine Government Building in Largest Drone Assault of War
summary: Ukrainians said it was the first time a key building in Kyiv’s government district had been damaged since the war began. Russia has kept attacking despite Trump administration efforts at peace talks.

title: Russia Steps Up Disinformation Efforts as Trump Abandons Resistance
summary: The Kremlin has begun a campaign to sway the parliamentary election in Moldova in what could become a new model of election interference online.

title: Immigration Raid Exposes Tensions From Seoul to Washington to Rural Georgia
summary: The raid at a Georgia plant being built with heavy investment from South Korea reveals strain as a rush to expand manufacturing in the United States clashes with an immigration crackdown.

title: What We Know About the Hyundai-LG Plant Immigration Raid in Georgia
summary: Several hundred workers, most of them South Korean nationals, were detained at the construction site of a sprawling electric vehicle battery plant on Thursday.

title: India’s Investors, Defying Tariffs, Keep Pouring Money Into Stocks
summary: Middle-class Indians have been plowing their savings into the stock market, making it far less vulnerable to the shocks of a trade war.

title: Trump Is Met With Mostly Boos at U.S. Open as Security Delays a Match
summary: With the president in attendance at Arthur Ashe Stadium, the men’s final began as hundreds of people were still waiting to go through security screening.

title: France, at an Impasse, Heads Toward Another Government Collapse
summary: A vote of confidence scheduled for Monday appears set to topple Prime Minister François Bayrou and put more pressure on President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Why France’s Financial Woes Are Pushing Its Government to the Brink
summary: The French prime minister has proposed drastic spending cuts and tax increases to shore up the country’s accounts, but his plan could backfire.

title: Houthi Drone Hits Israeli Airport After Warning System Failure
summary: The strike by the Yemeni militants followed the Israeli killing of several of their top leaders a week ago.

title: Japan’s Prime Minister, Shigeru Ishiba, Resigns: What to Know
summary: Japan, one of the world’s most stable democracies, is experiencing unusually rapid change. Shigeru Ishiba’s departure could herald a leadership crisis.

title: A Town Reluctantly Let a Mosque Expand. Then Came the Backlash.
summary: A Long Island town board failed to approve a settlement its lawyers had struck with Masjid Al-Baqi after a yearslong dispute tainted by bigotry. The mosque’s federal suit will be heard next month.

title: John Burton, 92, Dies; California Political Boss Who Staged a Comeback
summary: He left the House of Representatives while struggling with a crack addiction, his political career seemingly over. Actually, it had just begun.

title: Memorable Moments of the 2025 MTV Video Music Awards: Mariah Carey, Lady Gaga and More
summary: Mariah Carey and Busta Rhymes were honored for the first time, Lady Gaga crossed town and Doja Cat took it back to the 1980s.

title: 10 Best Red Carpet Looks at the MTV VMAs: Doja Cat, Sabrina Carpenter & More
summary: Feathery boas, loopy braids, a rare Labubu and more.

title: A New War Is Emerging in Colombia
summary: Colombia’s return to conflict is a lesson in how hard it is to sustain progress toward peace.

title: Stop Acting Like This Is Normal
summary: Democrats aren’t powerless, and they don’t have to enable autocracy.

title: West Point Alumni Group Cancels Award Honoring Tom Hanks
summary: The group was to bestow the Sylvanus Thayer Award on the actor, but it said it was canceling the event to focus on preparing academy cadets for the future.

title: Australian Woman, Erin Patterson, Gets Life in Mushroom Murder Case
summary: Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.

title: Brazilians Protest as Bolsonaro Coup Trial Nears Verdict
summary: Tensions are heating up in Brazil as the nation enters the final week of former President Jair Bolsonaro’s trial on attempted coup charges.
